original: Theravāda Vinaya
analyzed: thera vāda vinaya
translated: The Monastic Code of the Elders

original: Mahāvibhaṅga🔽Pācittiyakaṇḍa🔽Bhojanavagga
analyzed: mahāvibhaṅga  pācittiyakaṇḍa  bhojana vagga
translated: The Great Analysis🔽The chapter on offenses entailing confession🔽The sub-chapter on eating

original: 34. Kāṇamātusikkhāpada
analyzed: kāṇa mātu sikkhāpada
translated: The training rule on Kāṇamātā

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

original: Tena kho pana samayena kāṇamātā upāsikā saddhā hoti pasannā.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena kāṇamātā upāsikā saddhā hoti pasannā
translated: At that time the lay follower Kāṇamātā had faith and confidence.

original: Kāṇā gāmake aññatarassa purisassa dinnā hoti.
analyzed: kāṇā gāmake aññatarassa purisassa dinnā hoti
translated: She had given her daughter Kāṇā to a man in Kāṇagāma.

original: Atha kho kāṇā mātugharaṁ agamāsi kenacideva karaṇīyena.
analyzed: atha khalu kāṇā mātugharam agamāsi kenacid eva karaṇīyena
translated: On one occasion Kāṇā went to her mother’s house on some business.

original: Atha kho kāṇāya sāmiko kāṇāya santike dūtaṁ pāhesi—“āgacchatu kāṇā, icchāmi kāṇāya āgatan”ti.
analyzed: atha khalu kāṇāya sāmikaḥ kāṇāya santike dūtam pāhesi āgacchatu kāṇāḥ icchāmi kāṇāya āgatanti
translated: Then Kāṇā’s husband sent a message to Kāṇā: “Please come, I want to see you.”

original: Atha kho kāṇamātā upāsikā “kismiṁ viya rittahatthaṁ gantun”ti pūvaṁ paci.🔽Pakke pūve aññataro piṇḍacāriko bhikkhu kāṇamātāya upāsikāya nivesanaṁ pāvisi. Atha kho kāṇamātā upāsikā tassa bhikkhuno pūvaṁ dāpesi.
analyzed: atha kho kāṇa mātā upāsikā kismin viya ritta hattham gantunti pūvam paci  pakke pūve aññataraḥ piṇḍacārikaḥ bhikkhu kāṇamātāya upāsikāya nivesanam pāvisi atha kho kāṇamātā upāsikā tassa bhikkhuno pūvam dāpesi
translated: Kāṇamātā thought, “What can I take to her house without taking anything?” and she baked pastries.🔽When the pastries were baked, a certain monk who was walking for alms entered the house of Kāṇamātā. She then had a pastry given to that monk.

original: So nikkhamitvā aññassa ācikkhi. Tassapi pūvaṁ dāpesi.
analyzed: saḥ nikkhamitvā aññassa ācikkhi tassa api pūvam dāpesi
translated: He left and told another monk, and she also had a pastry given to him.

original: So nikkhamitvā aññassa ācikkhi. Tassapi pūvaṁ dāpesi.
analyzed: saḥ nikkhamitvā aññassa ācikkhi tassa api pūvam dāpesi
translated: He took it out and gave it to someone else.

original: Yathāpaṭiyattaṁ pūvaṁ parikkhayaṁ agamāsi.🔽Dutiyampi kho kāṇāya sāmiko kāṇāya santike dūtaṁ pāhesi—“āgacchatu kāṇā, icchāmi kāṇāya āgatan”ti.
analyzed: yathāpaṭiyattam pūvam parikkhayam agamāsi  dutiyam pi kho kāṇāya sāmikaḥ kāṇāya santike dūtam pāhesi āgacchatu kāṇāḥ icchāmi kāṇāya āgatanti
translated: The food that had been prepared was exhausted.🔽A second time Kāṇamātā’s husband sent a message to her, saying, “Please come, I want to see you.”

original: Dutiyampi kho kāṇamātā upāsikā “kismiṁ viya rittahatthaṁ gantun”ti pūvaṁ paci.🔽Pakke pūve aññataro piṇḍacāriko bhikkhu kāṇamātāya upāsikāya nivesanaṁ pāvisi.
analyzed: dutiyam pi kho kāṇa mātā upāsikā kismin viya rittahattham gantunti pūvam paci  pakke pūve aññataraḥ piṇḍacārikaḥ bhikkhu kāṇamātāya upāsikāya nivesanam pāvisi
translated: A second time Kāṇamātā thought, “How can I go empty-handed?” and she prepared food.🔽When the food was ready, a certain alms-collecting monk entered the house of Kāṇamātā.

original: Atha kho kāṇamātā upāsikā tassa bhikkhuno pūvaṁ dāpesi.🔽So nikkhamitvā aññassa ācikkhi. Tassapi pūvaṁ dāpesi.
analyzed: atha kho kāṇamātā upāsikā tassa bhikkhuno pūvam dāpesi  saḥ nikkhamitvā aññassa ācikkhi tassa api pūvam dāpesi
translated: Kāṇamātā gave him food.🔽He took it out and gave it to someone else.

original: So nikkhamitvā aññassa ācikkhi. Tassapi pūvaṁ dāpesi.
analyzed: saḥ nikkhamitvā aññassa ācikkhi tassa api pūvam dāpesi
translated: He took it out and gave it to someone else.

original: Yathāpaṭiyattaṁ pūvaṁ parikkhayaṁ agamāsi.
analyzed: yathāpaṭiyattam pūvam parikkhayam agamāsi
translated: The food that had been prepared was exhausted.

original: Tatiyampi kho kāṇāya sāmiko kāṇāya santike dūtaṁ pāhesi—“āgacchatu kāṇā, icchāmi kāṇāya āgataṁ.
analyzed: tatiyam pi kho kāṇāya sāmikaḥ kāṇāya santike dūtam pāhesi āgacchatu kāṇā icchāmi kāṇāya āgata
translated: A third time Kāṇamātā’s husband sent a message to her, saying, “Please come, I want to see you.”

original: Sace kāṇā nāgacchissati, ahaṁ aññaṁ pajāpatiṁ ānessāmī”ti.🔽Tatiyampi kho kāṇamātā upāsikā kismiṁ viya rittahatthaṁ gantunti pūvaṁ paci.🔽Pakke pūve aññataro piṇḍacāriko bhikkhu kāṇamātāya upāsikāya nivesanaṁ pāvisi.
analyzed: sace kāṇā na āgacchissati aham aññam pajāpatim ānessāmi iti  tatiyam pi kho kāṇa mātā upāsikā kismin viya rittahattham gantunti pūvam paci  pakke pūve aññataraḥ piṇḍacārikaḥ bhikkhu kāṇamātāya upāsikāya nivesanam pāvisi
translated: If she doesn’t come, I’ll get another wife.”🔽For a third time, Kāṇamātā thought, “It’s as if I’m going empty-handed to a place where I have to pay a toll.” And she baked pastries.

original: Atha kho kāṇamātā upāsikā tassa bhikkhuno pūvaṁ dāpesi.🔽So nikkhamitvā aññassa ācikkhi. Tassapi pūvaṁ dāpesi.🔽So nikkhamitvā aññassa ācikkhi. Tassapi pūvaṁ dāpesi.
analyzed: atha kho kāṇamātā upāsikā tassa bhikkhuno pūvam dāpesi  saḥ nikkhamitvā aññassa ācikkhi tassa api pūvam dāpesi  saḥ nikkhamitvā aññassa ācikkhi tassa api pūvam dāpesi
translated: When they were baked, a certain alms-collecting monk entered the house of Kāṇamātā.🔽She had him given pastries.🔽He left and told another monk, who was also given pastries.

original: Yathāpaṭiyattaṁ pūvaṁ parikkhayaṁ agamāsi.🔽Atha kho kāṇāya sāmiko aññaṁ pajāpatiṁ ānesi.
analyzed: yathāpaṭiyattam pūvam parikkhayam agamāsi  atha kho kāṇāya sāmikaḥ aññam pajāpatim ānesi
translated: He left and told another monk, who was also given pastries.🔽The pastries were all used up.🔽Kāṇamātā’s husband then got another wife.

original: Assosi kho kāṇā—“tena kira purisena aññā pajāpati ānītā”ti. Sā rodantī aṭṭhāsi.
analyzed: assosi kho kāṇātena kira purisena aññā pajāpati ānītā ati sā rodantī aṭṭhāsi
translated: When Kāṇā heard that, she stood crying.

original: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena kāṇamātāya upāsikāya nivesanaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya yena kāṇamātāya upāsikāya nivesanam tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi
translated: The following morning the Buddha robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to Kāṇamātā’s house, where he sat down on the prepared seat.

original: Atha kho kāṇamātā upāsikā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: atha khalu kāṇamātā upāsikā yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: She then went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho kāṇamātaraṁ upāsikaṁ bhagavā etadavoca—“kissāyaṁ kāṇā rodatī”ti? Atha kho kāṇamātā upāsikā bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesi.
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnam kho kāṇa mātaram upāsikam bhagavā etat avoca kissāyam kāṇā rodati iti atha kho kāṇa mātā upāsikā bhagavataḥ etam attham ārocesi
translated: and the Buddha said to her, “Why is this girl crying?” She told him what had happened.

original: Atha kho bhagavā kāṇamātaraṁ upāsikaṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā kāṇamātaram upāsikam dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahasetvā uṭṭhāya āsanā pakkāmi
translated: After instructing, inspiring, and gladdening her with a teaching, the Buddha got up from his seat and left.

original: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro sattho rājagahā paṭiyālokaṁ gantukāmo hoti.🔽Aññataro piṇḍacāriko bhikkhu taṁ satthaṁ piṇḍāya pāvisi.🔽Aññataro upāsako tassa bhikkhuno sattuṁ dāpesi.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena aññataraḥ satthaḥ rājagahā paṭiyālokam gantu kāmo hoti  aññataraḥ piṇḍacārikaḥ bhikkhu tam sattham piṇḍāya pāvisi  aññataraḥ upāsakaḥ tassa bhikkhuno sattum dāpesi
translated: On that occasion a caravan was about to leave Rājagaha for the country.🔽A certain alms-collecting monk entered that caravan for alms.🔽A certain lay follower gave him a meal.

original: So nikkhamitvā aññassa ācikkhi. Tassapi sattuṁ dāpesi.
analyzed: saḥ nikkhamitvā aññassa ācikkhi tassa api sattum dāpesi
translated: He told another monk, who also got a meal.

original: So nikkhamitvā aññassa ācikkhi. Tassapi sattuṁ dāpesi.
analyzed: saḥ nikkhamitvā aññassa ācikkhi tassa api sattum dāpesi
translated: He told another monk, who also got a meal.

original: Yathāpaṭiyattaṁ pātheyyaṁ parikkhayaṁ agamāsi.
analyzed: yathāpaṭiyattam pātheyyam parikkhayam agamāsi
translated: But the food they had prepared was exhausted.

original: Atha kho so upāsako te manusse etadavoca—🔽“ajjaṇho, ayyā, āgametha, yathāpaṭiyattaṁ pātheyyaṁ ayyānaṁ dinnaṁ.
analyzed: atha kho saḥ upāsakaḥ te manusse etat avoca  ajjaṇhaḥ ayyāḥ āgametha yathā paṭiyattam pātheyyam ayyānam dinna
translated: The lay follower said to them,

original: Pātheyyaṁ paṭiyādessāmī”ti.
analyzed: pātheyyam paṭiyādessāmi iti
translated: “Please wait until tomorrow. I’ll prepare food for you.”

original: “Nāyyo sakkā āgametuṁ, payāto sattho”ti agamaṁsu.
analyzed: nāyyaḥ sakkā āgametu payātaḥ satthā iti agamasu
translated: “We can’t wait. The caravan has already left.”

original: Atha kho tassa upāsakassa pātheyyaṁ paṭiyādetvā pacchā gacchantassa corā acchindiṁsu.
analyzed: atha kho tassa upāsakassa pātheyyam paṭiyādetvā pacchā gacchantassa corāḥ
translated: And after preparing the food, he was robbed by bandits while on his way to the monastery.

original: Manussā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
analyzed: manussāḥ ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti
translated: People complained and criticized those monks,

original: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā na mattaṁ jānitvā paṭiggahessanti.
analyzed: katham hi nāma samaṇāḥ sakyaputtiyāḥ na mattam jānitvā paṭiggahessanti
translated: “How can the Sakyan monastics not know moderation and then accept more food?

original: Ayaṁ imesaṁ datvā pacchā gacchanto corehi acchinno”ti.
analyzed: ayam da tvā pacchā gacchantaḥ corehi
translated: After giving to them, he was robbed by bandits while on his way to the monastery.”

original: Assosuṁ kho bhikkhū tesaṁ manussānaṁ ujjhāyantānaṁ khiyyantānaṁ vipācentānaṁ.
analyzed: assosum kho bhikkhū tesam manussānam ujjhāyantānam khiyyantānam vipācentāna
translated: The monks heard the complaints of those people,

original: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.
analyzed: atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavataḥ etam attham ārocesu
translated: and they told the Buddha.

original: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṁ nidāne etasmiṁ pakaraṇe dhammiṁ kathaṁ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā etasmim nidāne etasmim pakaraṇe dhammim katham katvā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: The Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

original: “tena hi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ sikkhāpadaṁ paññapessāmi dasa atthavase paṭicca—
analyzed: tena hi bhikkhave bhikkhūnam sikkhāpadam paññapessāmi dasa atthavase paṭicca
translated: “Well then, monks, I will lay down a training rule for the monks for ten reasons:

original: saṅghasuṭṭhutāya, saṅghaphāsutāya …pe… vinayānuggahāya.
analyzed: saṅgha suṭṭhutāya saṅgha phāsu tāya pe vinaya anuggahāya
translated: for the well-being of the Sangha, for the comfort of the Sangha, for the restraint of bad people, for the ease of good monks, for the restraint of corruptions relating to the present life, for the restraint of corruptions relating to future lives, to give rise to confidence in those without it, to increase the confidence of those who have it, for the longevity of the true Teaching, and for supporting the training.

original: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṁ sikkhāpadaṁ uddiseyyātha—
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave imam sikkhāpadam uddiseyyātha
translated: And, monks, you should learn this training rule in this way:

original: “Bhikkhuṁ paneva kulaṁ upagataṁ pūvehi vā manthehi vā abhihaṭṭhuṁ pavāreyya, ākaṅkhamānena bhikkhunā dvattipattapūrā paṭiggahetabbā tato ce uttari paṭiggaṇheyya pācittiyaṁ.
analyzed: bhikkhum pana iva kulam upagatam pūvehi vā manthehi vā abhihaṭṭhum pavāreyya ākaṅkhamānena bhikkhunā dvatti patta pūrā paṭiggahetabbā tatas ce uttari paṭiggaṇheyya pācittiya
translated: ‘If a monk has been invited to a meal and then asks for fresh or cooked food as a gift for himself, he may receive it with the intention of eating it, if it is less than two or three bowlfuls. If he receives more than that, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Dvattipattapūre paṭiggahetvā tato nīharitvā bhikkhūhi saddhiṁ saṁvibhajitabbaṁ. Ayaṁ tattha sāmīcī”ti.
analyzed: dvatti patta pūre paṭiggahetvā tatas nīharitvā bhikkhūhi saddhim ayam tattha sāmīcī iti
translated: After receiving it, he should take it away and share it with the monks. This is the proper conduct in this matter.’

original: Bhikkhuṁ paneva kulaṁ upagatanti
analyzed: bhikkhum pana iva kulam upagatanti
translated: If a monk has been invited to a meal:

original: kulaṁ nāma cattāri kulāni—khattiyakulaṁ, brāhmaṇakulaṁ, vessakulaṁ, suddakulaṁ.
analyzed: kulam nāma cattāri
translated: A family is one of four kinds: the aristocratic family, the brahmin family, the merchant family, the worker family.

original: Upagatanti
analyzed: upagatanti
translated: Has been invited:

original: tattha gataṁ.
analyzed: tattha gata
translated: has gone there.

original: Pūvaṁ nāma
analyzed: pūvam nāma
translated: Cooked food:

original: yaṁ kiñci paheṇakatthāya paṭiyattaṁ.
analyzed: yam kiñci paheṇakatthāya paṭiyatta
translated: whatever has been prepared for the purpose of being eaten.

original: Manthaṁ nāma🔽yaṁ kiñci pātheyyatthāya paṭiyattaṁ.
analyzed: mantham nāma  yam kiñci pātheyya tthāya paṭiyatta
translated: Congee:🔽whatever has been prepared for the purpose of being taken along.

original: Abhihaṭṭhuṁ pavāreyyāti🔽yāvatakaṁ icchasi tāvatakaṁ gaṇhāhīti.
analyzed: abhihaṭṭhum pavāreyya iti  yāvatakam icchasi tāvatakam gaṇhāhi iti
translated: To ask for more:🔽“Take as much as you like.”

original: Ākaṅkhamānenāti
analyzed: ākaṅkhamānena ati
translated: If he wishes:

original: icchamānena.🔽Dvattipattapūrā paṭiggahetabbāti
analyzed: icchamānena  dvatti patta pūrā paṭiggahetabbā ati
translated: if he desires.🔽He should receive it in two full almsbowls:

original: dvetayo pattapūrā paṭiggahetabbā.
analyzed: dve itayo patta pūrā paṭiggahetabbā
translated: he should receive it in two almsbowls filled to the brim.

original: Tato ce uttari paṭigaṇheyyāti
analyzed: tatas ce uttari paṭigaṇheyya ati
translated: If he receives more than that:

original: tatuttari paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
analyzed: tatuttari paṭiggaṇhāti āpatti pācittiyassa
translated: if he receives more than that, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Dvattipattapūre paṭiggahetvā
analyzed: paṭiggahetvā
translated: After receiving it in two full almsbowls,

original: tato nikkhamantena bhikkhuṁ passitvā ācikkhitabbaṁ—“amutra mayā dvattipattapūrā paṭiggahitā, mā kho tattha paṭiggaṇhī”ti.
analyzed: tatas nikkhamantena bhikkhum passitvā ācikkhitabba amutra mayā dvatti patta pūrā paṭiggahitā mā kho tattha paṭiggaṇhi iti
translated: if, when leaving, he sees a monk, he should inform him, saying, “I have received this much; don’t receive any.”

original: Sace passitvā na ācikkhati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: sace passitvā na ācikkhati āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If he does not inform him when he sees him, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Sace ācikkhite paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: sace ācikkhite paṭiggaṇhāti āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If he receives it after being informed, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Tato nīharitvā bhikkhūhi saddhiṁ saṁvibhajitabbanti
analyzed: tatas nīharitvā bhikkhūhi saddhim sa vibhajitabbanti
translated: He should share it with the monks after taking it out:

original: paṭikkamanaṁ nīharitvā saṁvibhajitabbaṁ.
analyzed: paṭikkamanam nīharitvā
translated: after going back, he should share it.

original: Ayaṁ tattha sāmīcīti
analyzed: ayam sāmīcī iti
translated: This is the proper conduct in this matter:

original: ayaṁ tattha anudhammatā.🔽Atirekadvattipattapūre atirekasaññī paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
analyzed: ayam tattha anudhamma tā  atireka dvatti patta pūre atireka saññī paṭiggaṇhāti āpatti pācittiyassa
translated: This is the proper conduct.🔽If it is more than two and a half patthas, and he perceives it as more, and he receives it, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Atirekadvattipattapūre vematiko paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti pācittiyassa.🔽Atirekadvattipattapūre ūnakasaññī paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti pācittiyassa.🔽Ūnakadvattipattapūre atirekasaññī, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: atireka dvatti patta pūre vematikaḥ paṭiggaṇhāti āpatti pācittiyassa  atireka dvatti patta pūre ūnaka saññī paṭiggaṇhāti āpatti pācittiyassa  ūnaka dvatti patta pūre atireka saññī āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If it is more than two and a half patthas, but he is unsure of it, and he receives it, he commits an offense entailing confession.🔽If it is more than two and a half patthas, but he perceives it as less, and he receives it, he commits an offense entailing confession.🔽If it is less than two and a half patthas, but he perceives it as more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Ūnakadvattipattapūre vematiko, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: ūnaka dvatti patta pūre vematikaḥ āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If it is less than two and a half patthas, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Ūnakadvattipattapūre ūnakasaññī, anāpatti.
analyzed: ūnaka dvatti patta pūre ūnaka saññī anāpatti
translated: If it is less than two and a half patthas, and he perceives it as less, there is no offense.

original: Anāpatti—🔽dvattipattapūre paṭiggaṇhāti,
analyzed: anāpatti  paṭiggaṇhāti
translated: There is no offense if🔽he receives less than two and a half patthas;

original: ūnakadvattipattapūre paṭiggaṇhāti,🔽na paheṇakatthāya na pātheyyatthāya paṭiyattaṁ denti,
analyzed: ūnaka dvatti patta pūre paṭiggaṇhāti  na paheṇaka tthāya na pātheyya tthāya paṭiyattam denti
translated: he receives less than two and a half patthas;🔽they give what has not been prepared for the purpose of carrying;

original: paheṇakatthāya vā pātheyyatthāya vā paṭiyattasesakaṁ denti,
analyzed: paheṇaka tthāya vā pātheyya tthāya vā paṭiyatta sesakam denti
translated: they give what is left over from what has been prepared for the purpose of carrying;

original: gamane paṭippassaddhe denti,🔽ñātakānaṁ,
analyzed: gamane paṭippassaddhe denti  ñātakāna
translated: they give when the journey has been interrupted;🔽to relatives;

original: pavāritānaṁ,
analyzed: pavāritāna
translated: to those who have given permission;

original: aññassatthāya,
analyzed: aññassa atthāya
translated: if it is for the benefit of someone else;

original: attano dhanena,
analyzed: attanaḥ dhanena
translated: if he uses his own property;

original: ummattakassa,
analyzed: ummattakassa
translated: if he is insane;

original: ādikammikassāti.
analyzed: ādikammikassa ati
translated: if he is the first offender.

original: Kāṇamātusikkhāpadaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ catutthaṁ.
analyzed: kāṇamātu sikkhāpadam niṭṭhitam catuttha
translated: The training rule on Kāṇamātā is finished.
